meanings.definition: To remove the outer covering or skin from a fruit or vegetable.
meanings.sent1: I peel the apple before eating it.
meanings.sent2: She carefully peeled the potato with a knife.
meanings.sent3: Why did the banana go to the party? Because it wanted to peel out!
meanings.sent4: The layers of paint began to peel off the old wall like memories fading away.
meanings.sent5: The sunburn made her skin peel painfully.

meanings.definition: A thin outer covering or layer of something.
meanings.sent1: The orange peel adds flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent2: He slipped on the banana peel and fell.
meanings.sent3: The onion peel made him cry more than cutting it.
meanings.sent4: The fog created a mystical peel over the lake.
meanings.sent5: The delicate peel of the egg cracked easily.

meanings.definition: To come off in thin pieces or strips.
meanings.sent1: The wallpaper started to peel in the humid room.
meanings.sent2: The old paint on the fence began to peel in the sun.
meanings.sent3: Why did the orange refuse to play hide and seek? Because it didn't want to peel off!
meanings.sent4: The years seemed to peel away from her face after using the new cream.
meanings.sent5: The bark of the tree started to peel, revealing a smooth surface underneath.
